title: Temple of Amun-Re layout and effect

content.question: A pharaoh progressing through the temple complex was intended to encounter

choices.label: spaces arranged at oblique angles, which culminated in a majestic, light-filled foyer
spaces that were increasingly dark and mysterious, leading to the inner sanctum housing the cult statue
a series of open courtyards and halls illuminated with clerestory windows that led to the pharaohâ€™s throne room
narrow, serpentine walkways that mimicked the flow of the Nile River, terminating at a sacred pool

content.answer: spaces that were increasingly dark and mysterious, leading to the inner sanctum housing the cult statue

topic.text: 2.3: Purpose and Audience in Ancient Mediterranean Art

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
